sen.j: 孝徳天皇（こうとくてんのう、推古天皇4年（596年） - 白雉5年10月10日 (旧暦)（654年11月24日））は、日本の第36代天皇（在位：孝徳天皇元年6月14日 (旧暦)（645年7月12日） - 白雉5年10月10日（654年11月24日））。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku (Emperor Suiko 4 (596) - November 24, 654) was the thirty-sixth Emperor in Japan (the reign: the first year of Emperor Kotoku June 14 (July 12, 645 - November 24, 654).
Emperor Kotoku (596 - November 24, 654) was the thirty-sixth Emperor of Japan (reign: July 12, 645 - November 24, 654).
Emperor Kotoku (596 - November 24, 654) was the thirty-sixth Emperor of Japan (reign: July 12, 645 - November 24, 654).

sen.j: 諱は軽皇子（かるのみこ）。
sen.e: The imina (personal name) was Prince Karu.
His imina (personal name) was Prince Karu.
His imina (personal name) was Prince Karu.

sen.j: 和風諡号は天万豊日天皇（あめよろずとよひのすめらみこと）。
sen.e: Japanese-style posthumous name was Ameyorozutoyohi no Sumeramikoto.
His Japanese-style posthumous name was Ameyorozutoyohi no Sumeramikoto.
His Japanese-style posthumous name was Ameyorozutoyohi no Sumeramikoto.

sen.j: その在位中には難波宮に宮廷があったことから、後世その在位時期をその政策（後世のいうところの大化改新）などを含めて難波朝（なにわちょう）という別称で称されることがあった。
sen.e: During the reign the palace existed in Naniwa-no-miya (Naniwa Palace), and thus later the period of reign was sometimes called Naniwa Court (Naniwa cho) as another name because of the political measure (the Taika Reforms in later days).

During his reign there was a court in Naniwa-no-miya (Naniwa Palace), and thus later the period of his reign including its policies (known later as the Taika Reforms) and such were sometimes referred to as Naniwa-cho (Naniwa Court).
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。意味を原文と一致するよう修正しました。
sen.e: During his reign there was a court in Naniwa-no-miya (Naniwa Palace), and thus later the period of his reign including its policies (known later as the Taika Reforms) and such were sometimes referred to as Naniwa-cho (Naniwa Court).

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography.
Biography
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Biography

sen.j: 敏達天皇の孫で押坂彦人大兄皇子王子茅渟王（ちぬのおおきみ）の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko Chinu no Okimi, a grandson of Emperor Bidatsu.
He was the eldest son of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko Chinu no Okim, and Emperor Bidatsu's grandson.
sen.cmt: 単／複数の関係ない表現に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko Chinu no Okim, and Emperor Bidatsu's grandson.

sen.j: 母は吉備姫王（きびひめのおおきみ）という。
sen.e: His mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.
His mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.
His mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.

sen.j: 皇極天皇（斉明天皇）の同母弟で、天智天皇（中大兄皇子）の叔父にあたる。
sen.e: He was a younger maternal half-brother of Emperor Kogyoku (Emperor Saimei) and an uncle of Emperor Tenchi (Naka no Oe no Oji).
Emperor Kogyoku (Emperor Saimei) was his elder maternal half-sister, and Emperor Tenchi (Naka no Oe no Oji) was his nephew.
sen.cmt: 単／複数の関係ない表現に修正しました。
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku (Emperor Saimei) was his elder maternal half-sister, and Emperor Tenchi (Naka no Oe no Oji) was his nephew.

sen.j: 皇極天皇の娘の間人皇女を皇后にした。
sen.e: He made Hashihito no Himemiko, a daughter of Emperor Kogyoku, his Empress.
He made Emperor Kogyoku's daughter Hashihito no Himemiko his Empress.
sen.cmt: 単／複数の関係ない表現に修正しました。
sen.e: He made Emperor Kogyoku's daughter Hashihito no Himemiko his Empress.

sen.j: 阿倍倉梯麻呂の娘の小足媛（おたらしひめ）を妃として、有間皇子を儲けた。
sen.e: He made Otarashihime, a daughter of ABE no Kurahashimaro, his Empress and had Prince Arima.
He married ABE no Kurahashimaro's daughter Otarashihime, and fathered Prince Arima.
sen.cmt: 単／複数の関係ない表現に修正しました。皇后と妃の差を表すため、empressではなくmarriedという表現を使いました。Had→fathered
sen.e: He married ABE no Kurahashimaro's daughter Otarashihime, and fathered Prince Arima.

sen.j: 蘇我倉山田石川麻呂の娘の乳娘（ちのいらつめ）を妃とした。
sen.e: He made Chinoiratsume, a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, his Empress.
He married SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro's daughter Chinoiratsume.
sen.cmt: 単／複数の関係ない表現に修正しました。皇后と妃の差を表すため、empressではなくmarriedという表現を使いました。
sen.e: He married SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro's daughter Chinoiratsume.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の評によれば、天皇は仏法を尊び、神道を軽んじた。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Emperor respected the Buddhist law, but took Shinto lightly.
According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the emperor was a stout Buddhist and looked lightly upon the Shinto religion.
sen.cmt: 大文字を修正しました。意味を原文と一致するよう修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the emperor was a stout Buddhist and looked lightly upon the Shinto religion.

sen.j: 柔仁で儒者を好み、貴賎を問わずしきりに恩勅を下した。
sen.e: He was calm and collected, liked a Confucian and often granted imperial clemency irrespective of high and low social standing.
He was calm and collected, liked Confucian scholars and often granted imperial clemency irrespective of the subject's social standing.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語に修正しました。
sen.e: He was calm and collected, liked Confucian scholars and often granted imperial clemency irrespective of the subject's social standing.

sen.j: 皇極天皇4年（645年）6月に乙巳の変が起きると、14日に皇極天皇は中大兄皇子に位を譲ろうとした。
sen.e: When Isshi-no-hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi) happened in June of the year 4 of Emperor Kogyoku (645), Emperor Kogyoku tried to give the throne to Naka no Oe no Oji on 14.
Isshi-no-hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi) occurred in June 645, and Emperor Kogyoku tried to pass on the throne to Naka no Oe no Oji on June 14.
sen.cmt: 日付が明確になるよう修正しました。年号を削除しました。
sen.e: Isshi-no-hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi) occurred in June 645, and Emperor Kogyoku tried to pass on the throne to Naka no Oe no Oji on June 14.

sen.j: 中大兄は辞退して軽皇子を推薦した。
sen.e: Naka no Oe no Oji refused it and recommended it to Prince Karu.
Naka no Oe no Oji refused it and recommended Prince Karu instead.
sen.cmt: 天皇の座を推薦したのではなく、軽皇子を推薦したと修正しました。
sen.e: Naka no Oe no Oji refused it and recommended Prince Karu instead.

sen.j: 軽皇子は三度辞退して、古人大兄皇子を推薦したが、古人大兄は辞退して出家した。
sen.e: Prince Karu refused it three times, recommended it to Furuhito no Oe no Miko, but Furuhito no Oe no Miko refused it and became a priest.
Prince Karu refused the throne three times and recommended Furuhito no Oe no Miko, but Furuhito no Oe no Miko refused it and became a priest.
Prince Karu refused the throne three times and recommended Furuhito no Oe no Miko, but Furuhito no Oe no Miko refused it and became a priest.

sen.j: 14日のうちに、軽皇子は壇に登って即位した。
sen.e: On 14 Prince Karu stepped on the stage and assumed the throne.
On June 14 Prince Karu stepped onto the stage and assumed the throne.
sen.cmt: 日付を明確にしました。
sen.e: On June 14 Prince Karu stepped onto the stage and assumed the throne.

sen.j: 皇極天皇に皇祖母尊（すめみおやのみこと）という称号を与え、中大兄を皇太子とした。
sen.e: He gave Emperor Kogyoku the title Sumemioya no mikoto and made Naka no Oe no Oji the Crown Prince.
He gave Emperor Kogyoku the title Sumemioya no mikoto and made Naka no Oe no Oji the Crown Prince.
He gave Emperor Kogyoku the title Sumemioya no mikoto and made Naka no Oe no Oji the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 阿倍内麻呂（阿倍倉梯麻呂）を左大臣に、蘇我石川麻呂を右大臣にした。
sen.e: He made ABE no Uchimaro (ABE no Kurahashimaro) Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Soga no ishikawa no maro Udaijin (minister of the right).
He made ABE no Uchimaro (ABE no Kurahashimaro) Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Soga no ishikawa no Maro Udaijin (minister of the right).
sen.cmt: 大文字を修正しました。
sen.e: He made ABE no Uchimaro (ABE no Kurahashimaro) Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Soga no ishikawa no Maro Udaijin (minister of the right).

sen.j: 中臣鎌子（藤原鎌足）を内臣とした。
sen.e: He made NAKATOMI no Kamako (FUJIWARA no Kamatari) Uchitsuomi (an important governmental post presiding over important state affairs while assisting the Emperor).
He made NAKATOMI no Kamako (FUJIWARA no Kamatari) Uchitsuomi (an important governmental post presiding over important state affairs while assisting the Emperor).
He made NAKATOMI no Kamako (FUJIWARA no Kamatari) Uchitsuomi (an important governmental post presiding over important state affairs while assisting the Emperor).

sen.j: 僧旻と高向玄理を国博士とした。
sen.e: He made Somin and TAKAMUKU no Kuromaro Kunihakase (teacher of Japanese classical literature).
He made Somin and TAKAMUKU no Kuromaro Kunihakase (teachers of Japanese classical literature).
sen.cmt: 二人なので複数に修正しました。
sen.e: He made Somin and TAKAMUKU no Kuromaro Kunihakase (teachers of Japanese classical literature).

sen.j: 初めて元号を立てて、大化元年（645年）とし、650年には白雉に改元した。
sen.e: He firstly established gengo (an era name), made it the first year of Taika (645) and changed the gengo to Hakuchi in 650.
He was the first to establish gengo (an era name), designating 645 as the first year of Taika, and in 650 changed the gengo to Hakuchi in 650.
sen.cmt: 意味が原文と一致するよう修正しました。
sen.e: He was the first to establish gengo (an era name), designating 645 as the first year of Taika, and in 650 changed the gengo to Hakuchi in 650.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』が伝えるところによれば、大化元年から翌年にかけて、孝徳天皇は各分野で制度改革を行なった。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," Emperor Kotoku did system reforms in various fields from the first year of Taika to the next year.
According to "Nihonshoki," Emperor Kotoku implemented system reforms in various fields from 645 through the following year.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語に修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," Emperor Kotoku implemented system reforms in various fields from 645 through the following year.

sen.j: この改革を、後世の学者は大化改新と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These reforms are called the Taika Reforms by scholars in future generations.
These reforms came to be called the Taika Reforms by later scholars.
sen.cmt: Future generationsは未来となるので、「後の」と修正しました。
sen.e: These reforms came to be called the Taika Reforms by later scholars.

sen.j: この改革につき書紀が引用する改新之詔4条のうち、第1条と第4条は、後代の官制を下敷きにして改変されたものであることがわかっている。
sen.e: Among Kaishin no Mikotonori's (the Imperial Reform Edict) four articles which the Chronicles cited regarding these reforms, the first one and the fourth one are known to have been changed and improved based on the government-regulated organization or facility, etc of posterity.

Among Kaishin no Mikotonori's (the Imperial Reform Edict) four articles which the Chronicles cited regarding these reforms, the first and the fourth are known to have been altered based on the government regulations of later generations.
sen.cmt: 不要なOneを削除しました。不適切な訳語を修正しました。
sen.e: Among Kaishin no Mikotonori's (the Imperial Reform Edict) four articles which the Chronicles cited regarding these reforms, the first and the fourth are known to have been altered based on the government regulations of later generations.

sen.j: このことから、書紀が述べるような大改革はこのとき存在しなかったのではないかという説が唱えられ、大化改新論争という日本史学上の一大争点になっている。
sen.e: For this reason, some claimed that the big reforms which the Chronicles described did not exist, which became a big dispute in the study of history of Japan, calling it the dispute on the Taika Reforms.

For this reason, some claim that the major reforms which the Chronicles described had not occurred at this time, and this has become an extremely controversial point regarding the history of Japan, referred to as the Taika Reform Dispute.

For this reason, some claim that the major reforms which the Chronicles described had not occurred at this time, and this has become an extremely controversial point regarding the history of Japan, referred to as the Taika Reform Dispute.

sen.j: 孝徳天皇の在位中には、高句麗、百済、新羅からしばしば使者が訪れた。
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Kotoku, the envoys often visited from Goguryeo (kingdom of Korea), Kudara (Baekje, Paekche) and Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom).
During the reign of Emperor Kotoku, envoys often visited from Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla (the three kingdoms of Korea).
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。高句麗、百済、新羅は朝鮮半島の三大国家と訳しました。（参照：英語版wikipedia）
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Kotoku, envoys often visited from Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla (the three kingdoms of Korea).

sen.j: 従来の百済のほかに、朝鮮半島で守勢にたった新羅も人質を送ってきた。
sen.e: Not only traditionally from Kudara but from Shiragi which was on the defensive in Korean peninsula, the hostages were sent.
Hostages were sent not only from Baekje as in the past, but also from Silla which was on the defensive in the Korean peninsula.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語に修正しました。
sen.e: Hostages were sent not only from Baekje as in the past, but also from Silla which was on the defensive in the Korean peninsula.

sen.j: 日本（当時は倭）は、形骸のみとなっていた任那の調を廃止した。
sen.e: Japan (Wa in those days) abolished the survey of Mimana which became a mere façade.
Japan (Wa in those days) abolished the survey of Mimana which had become a mere façade.
Japan (Wa in those days) abolished the survey of Mimana which had become a mere façade.

sen.j: 多数の随員を伴う遣唐使を唐 に派遣した。
sen.e: Japan sent Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) to Tang with the many followers.
An envoy with accompanied by many personnel was sent to Tang (China).
sen.cmt: 一般的な文章に修正しました。
sen.e: An envoy with accompanied by many personnel was sent to Tang (China).

sen.j: 北の蝦夷に対しては、渟足柵、磐舟柵を越国に築き、柵戸を置いて備えた。
sen.e: Against northern Emishi, Nutari no Ki (stockades) and Iwafune no Ki (system of stockades) were built in Koshi Province and Sakuko (immigrants from Kanto and Hokuriku region who were forced to work for the government) were put for the protection.

Josaku (stockades) called Nutari no Ki and Iwafune no Ki were built in Koshi Province to defend against the northern Emishi people, manned by Sakuko (immigrants from the Kanto and Hokuriku regions who were forced to work for the government).
sen.cmt: 一般的な文章に修正しました。
sen.e: Josaku (stockades) called Nutari no Ki and Iwafune no Ki were built in Koshi Province to defend against the northern Emishi people, manned by Sakuko (immigrants from the Kanto and Hokuriku regions who were forced to work for the government).

sen.j: 史料に見える城柵と柵戸の初めである。
sen.e: This is the first appearance of josaku (an official defense site) and Sakuko in historical documents.
This is the first appearance of josaku (an official defense site) and Sakuko in historical documents.
This is the first appearance of josaku (an official defense site) and Sakuko in historical documents.

sen.j: 孝徳天皇は難波長柄豊崎宮（大阪市中央区 (大阪市)）を造営し、そこを日本の首都と定めた。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku built Naniwa no Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya Palace (Chuo Ward, Osaka City (Osaka City)) and designated it the capital of Japan.
Emperor Kotoku built Naniwa no Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya Palace (Chuo Ward, Osaka City [Osaka City]) and designated the city as the capital of Japan.
sen.cmt: 内括弧を修正しました。建築物ではなく都市が首都となるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku built Naniwa no Nagara no Toyosaki no Miya Palace (Chuo Ward, Osaka City [Osaka City]) and designated the city as the capital of Japan.

sen.j: が、白雉4年（653年）に、皇太子は天皇に倭京に遷ることを求めた。
sen.e: However in 653, the crown prince asked Emperor to move to the City in Yamato.
However in 653, the crown prince asked the emperor to move to the City in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 大文字、冠詞を修正しました。
sen.e: However in 653, the crown prince asked the emperor to move to the City in Yamato.

sen.j: 天皇がこれを退けると、皇太子は皇祖母尊と皇后、皇弟（天武天皇）を連れて倭に赴いた。
sen.e: When Emperor refused it, the prince moved to the City in Yamato with his mother, the Founders of the Imperial Family, Empress and his younger brother (Emperor Tenmu).
When the emperor refused, the crown prince moved to the City in Yamato with Empress Kogyoku, his empress and his younger brother (Emperor Tenmu).
sen.cmt: 大文字、冠詞を修正しました。分かりやすいよう皇祖母尊は皇極天皇としました。
sen.e: When the emperor refused, the crown prince moved to the City in Yamato with Empress Kogyoku, his empress and his younger brother (Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: 臣下の大半が皇太子に随って去った。
sen.e: Most of vassals left following the prince.
Most of vassals left following the prince.
Most of vassals left following the prince.

sen.j: 天皇は気を落とし、翌年病気になって亡くなった。
sen.e: Emperor was disappointed with this and the next year fell sick and passed away.
The emperor was disappointed with this and the next year fell sick and passed away.
sen.cmt: 大文字、冠詞を修正しました。
sen.e: The emperor was disappointed with this and the next year fell sick and passed away.

sen.j: 近年では、軽皇子が中大兄皇子を教唆して「乙巳の変」を引き起こした「黒幕」であるという説を唱える歴史学者もいる。
sen.e: Nowadays, some historians claims that Prince Karu was the 'mastermind' who abetted Naka no Oe no Oji to cause 'Isshi no hen.'
Nowadays, some historians claim that Prince Karu was the 'mastermind' who abetted Naka no Oe no Oji to cause 'Isshi no hen.'
Nowadays, some historians claim that Prince Karu was the 'mastermind' who abetted Naka no Oe no Oji to cause 'Isshi no hen.'

sen.j: しかし軽皇子が即位して後重用したのは蘇我氏系豪族が多く、今後の議論が待たれる。
sen.e: However, Prince Karu gave important posts to many local ruling families of Soga clan after he was coronated, which needs the discussion in future years.
However, Prince Karu gave important posts to many local ruling families of the Soga clan after he ascended the throne, which is sure to invite debate in future years.
However, Prince Karu gave important posts to many local ruling families of the Soga clan after he ascended the throne, which is sure to invite debate in future years.

sen.j: 年譜
sen.e: Chronological list of the main events.
Chronological List of Major Events
Chronological List of Major Events

sen.j: 皇極天皇4年（645年）
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku 4 (645).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 中大兄皇子が蘇我入鹿を殺害。
sen.e: - Naka no Oe no Oji killed Soga no Iruka.
- Naka no Oe no Oji killed Soga no Iruka.
- Naka no Oe no Oji killed Soga no Iruka.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 蘇我蝦夷が自宅に火を放ち自殺する。
sen.e: - Soga no Emishi put his house on fire and committed suicide.
- Soga no Emishi set his house on fire and committed suicide.
- Soga no Emishi set his house on fire and committed suicide.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 即位した。
sen.e: - He assumed the throne.
- Emperor Kotoku assumed the throne.
- Emperor Kotoku assumed the throne.

sen.j: この年を大化元年とした。
sen.e: This year was designated to be the first year of Taika.
This year was designated the first year of Taika.
sen.cmt: 動詞の不適切な使用を修正しました。
sen.e: This year was designated the first year of Taika.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 皇后と2人の妃を立てた。
sen.e: - He made Empress and two wives.
- He married his empress and two other wives.
sen.cmt: 不適切な動詞を変えました。皇后と妃の違いが分かる表現にしました。
sen.e: - He married his empress and two other wives.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 高句麗、百済、新羅の使者が朝貢した。
sen.e: - The envoys from Goguryeo, Kudara and Shiragi brought tributes.
- Envoys from Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla brought tributes.
- Envoys from Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla brought tributes.

sen.j: 任那の調を代行した百済の使者に対し、調の不足を叱責した。
sen.e: He reprimanded the envoy from Kudara who acted for the survey of Mimana because of the lack of cho (tributes).
He reprimanded the envoy from Baekje who had brought Minama's tributes because of the insufficient amount.
sen.cmt: 不要な日本語を削除しまた。
sen.e: He reprimanded the envoy from Baekje who had brought Minama's tributes because of the insufficient amount.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 尾張国と美濃国に神に供える幣を課した。
sen.e: - He imposed nusa (symbols of divinity made of cloth or paper and hung on a pole) for gods on Owari Province and Mino Province.
- He imposed nusa (symbols of divinity made of cloth or paper and hung on a pole) for gods on Owari Province and Mino Province.
- He imposed nusa (symbols of divinity made of cloth or paper and hung on a pole) for gods on Owari Province and Mino Province.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 東国等の国司を任命し,戸籍の作成と田畑の検校などを命じた。
sen.e: - He appointed Kokushi (provincial governor) in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and so on, and ordered them to make koseki (the household registers) and to survey fields.
sen.cmt: 「検校」を、「検地」と受け取りました。
sen.e: - He appointed Kokushi (provincial governors) in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and so on, and ordered them to create koseki (household registers) and survey fields.
- He appointed Kokushi (provincial governors) in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and so on, and ordered them to create koseki (household registers) and survey fields.

sen.j: 朝廷に鐘を備え、訴訟の遅滞に抗議する者が撞くようにした。
sen.e: He prepared the bell in Imperial court and those who protested for the delay of lawsuit rang the bell.
He prepared a bell in the imperial court for those protesting the delay of lawsuits to ring.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。自然な英語に修正しました。

- Furuhito no Oe no Miko tried to rise in revolt.

sen.e: - Naka no Oe no Oji dedicated his own iribe and miyake (empire-controlled territory) to the Emperor.

sen.e: - He stipulated the institution of tombing for vassals and common people and forbade martyrdom.

sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: He ordered the registration of contracted horse breeding en route to the capital and prohibited fraud.

sen.e: - He abolished Shinabe (technicians in offices) and old positions and re-established all official positions, and issued the policy to ordain official court ranks.

sen.e: - He sent TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro to Silla and made them stop the survey of Mimana.

sen.e: He went to Kawazu no karimiya.

- He appointed Kose no Tokuta sadaijin (Minister of the left) and Otomo no Nagatoko udaijin (minister of the right).
- He appointed Kose no Tokuta sadaijin (Minister of the left) and Otomo no Nagatoko udaijin (minister of the right).

sen.j: - 白雉を観る儀式を行い、大赦し、白雉と改元し、D265に鷹を放つことを禁じ、同国の調を3年間免除した。

sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。Made it general amnestyをgranted amnestyにしました。白雉の説明を追加しました。Unmewingをreleaseにしました。exempted~の表現を変えました。
sen.e: - He held a ceremony to see the white Japanese pheasant, granted amnesty and changed the name of the era to Hakuchi (white pheasant), forbade the release of hawks in Anato Province and exempted Anato Province from giving tributes for three years.

sen.j: - 新羅が使を遣わして調を貢いだ。

sen.e: - He gave things to people who had had their family tombs destroyed or had been made to relocate to make room for the new palace, and had ARATAI no Hirabu put up a sign marking the boundary of the palace.

sen.e: This year.
Other Events This Year
sen.cmt: 分かりやすいタイトルにしました。
sen.e: Other Events This Year

sen.j: 山口大口が詔を受けて千仏の像を刻んだ。
sen.e: Yamaguchi no Oguchiatai received an imperial edict and worked up thousand Buddha statues.
sen.cmt: 「山口大口」は、「山口大口費」としました。
sen.e: Yamaguchi no Oguchiatai was commissioned to carve one thousand Buddha statues.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: Yamaguchi no Oguchiatai was commissioned to carve one thousand Buddha statues.

sen.j: 安芸国に百済舶2隻を造らせた。
sen.e: He made Aki Province build two Kudara ships.
He commissioned Aki Province to build two Baekje-style ships.
sen.cmt: Made→commissioned ~ to「百済風」と解釈しました。
sen.e: He commissioned Aki Province to build two Baekje-style ships.

sen.j: 白雉2年（651年）
sen.e: Hakuchi 2 (651).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 百済と新羅が使を遣わして調を貢ぎ物を献じた。
sen.e: - Kudara and Shiragi sent the envoys to bring tributes and dedicate cho.
- Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes and gifts.
sen.cmt: 英語版wikipediaの名称と統一しました。冠詞を修正しました。貢ぎ物をgiftsとしました。
sen.e: - Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes and gifts.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 大郡から新しい宮に遷り、そこを難波長柄豊碕宮と名づけた（大化元年12月9日に同趣旨の記事あり）。
sen.e: - He moved from Ogori to a new palace and named it Naniwa Nagara Toyosaki no Miya (there is an article whose subject is the same in December 9, 645).
- He moved from Ogori to a new palace and named it Naniwa Nagara Toyosaki no Miya Palace (there is an article dated December 9, 645 with the same subject).
sen.cmt: Palaceを追加しました。括弧内を自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - He moved from Ogori to a new palace and named it Naniwa Nagara Toyosaki no Miya Palace (there is an article dated December 9, 645 with the same subject).

tit.cmt: 分かりやすいタイトルにしました。

sen.j: - 新羅の貢調使の知万が唐国の服を着て筑紫国に着いたので、その変更をとがめて追い返した。
sen.e: - Chima in a costume of Tang, Kochoshi (envoy to bring tributes) from Shiragi, arrived in Tsukushi Province and he condemned the change and drove Chima back.
- Chima, the envoy bringing tributes from Silla, arrived at Tsukushi Province in Tang costume – the change was condemned and he was driven back.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: - Chima, the envoy bringing tributes from Silla, arrived at Tsukushi Province in Tang costume – the change was condemned and he was driven back.

sen.j: 白雉3年（652年）
sen.e: Hakuchi 3 (652).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 元日礼を終えてから、大郡宮に行った。
sen.e: - After he finished New Year's Greetings, he went to Ogori no miya.
- After he finished New Year's Greetings, he went to Ogori no Miya Palace.
- After he finished New Year's Greetings, he went to Ogori no Miya Palace.

tit.cmt: Unknown Monthの方が適切かと思います。

sen.j: - 班田を完了した。
sen.e: - He finished handen (the allotted farmland).
- He finished allotting farmland.
- He finished allotting farmland.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 難波宮に帰った。
sen.e: - He came back to Naniwa no Miya.
- He returned to Naniwa no Miya.
- He returned to Naniwa no Miya.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 僧恵隠を内裏に呼び,無量寿経を講じさせ,沙門恵資を論議者とし,沙門1000人を作聴衆にした。
sen.e: - He called the priest Eon to the dairi (Imperial Palace), ordered him to give a lecture on Sutra of Immeasurable Life, made shamon (priest) Eshi his discussant and 1000 shamon became the audience.

- He called the priest Eon to the Imperial Palace, ordered him to give a lecture on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life, appointed shamon (priest) Eshi to debate with him and 1000 shamon to be the audience.
sen.cmt: Dairiは削除しました。Theを追加しました。Madeをappointedにしました。Discussantをto debate with himにしました。Becameをto beにしました。
sen.e: - He called the priest Eon to the Imperial Palace, ordered him to give a lecture on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life, appointed shamon (priest) Eshi to debate with him and 1000 shamon to be the audience.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 講じ終えた。
sen.e: - He finished the lecture.
- He finished a lecture.
- He finished a lecture.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 古代の戸籍制度を造った。
sen.e: - He established the family registration system in ancient times.
- He established the family registration system of ancient times.
- He established the family registration system of ancient times.

sen.j: 百済と新羅が使を遣わして調を貢ぎ物を献じた。
sen.e: Kudara and Shiragi sent the envoys to bring cho.
Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes.
sen.cmt: 前の文章と同じにしました。
sen.e: Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 宮が完成した。
sen.e: - The palace was completed.
- The palace was completed.
- The palace was completed.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 天下の僧尼を内裏に呼び、設斎、大捨、燃明した。
sen.e: - He called monks and nuns in the world to the dairi, wined and dined them, gave charity generously and burned a fire.
- He called the monks and nuns of his empire to the imperial palace, entertained them, generously gave alms and burned a fire.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。燃明が不明です。
sen.e: - He called the monks and nuns of his empire to the imperial palace, entertained them, generously gave alms and burned a fire.

sen.j: 白雉4年（653年）
sen.e: Hakuchi 4 (653).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 遣唐使を送った。
sen.e: - He sent Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).
- He sent an envoy to Tang (China).
sen.cmt: 一般的な文章に修正しました。
sen.e: - He sent an envoy to Tang (China).

sen.j: 一船の大使は吉士長丹、副使は吉士駒であった。
sen.e: Taishi of a ship was KISHI no Nagani and the vice commander was KISHI no Koma.
The commander-in-chief of the first ship was KISHI no Nagani and the vice commander was KISHI no Koma.
sen.cmt: Taishiをcommander-in-chiefにしました。Of the first shipを追加しました。
sen.e: The commander-in-chief of the first ship was KISHI no Nagani and the vice commander was KISHI no Koma.

sen.j: 別の一船の大使は高田根麻呂、副使は掃守小麻呂であった。
sen.e: Taishi of another ship was TAKADA no Nemaro and the vice commander was KANIMORI no Omaro.
The commander-in-chief of the other ship was TAKADA no Nemaro and the vice commander was KANIMORI no Omaro.
sen.cmt: Taishiをcommander-in-chiefにしました。Another shipをthe other shipにしました。
sen.e: The commander-in-chief of the other ship was TAKADA no Nemaro and the vice commander was KANIMORI no Omaro.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 病中の旻法師の部屋に見舞いに行き、直接やさしい言葉をかけた（白雉5年7月とも）。
sen.e: - He visited the room where Minhoshi was sick in bed and spoke to him directly and softly (also in July, Hakuchi 5).
- He visited the room where Minhoshi was lying ill and directly offered kind words (also in July, 654).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。年号を西暦に変えました。
sen.e: - He visited the room where Minhoshi was lying ill and directly offered kind words (also in July, 654).

sen.j: 6月
sen.e: June.
June
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: June

sen.j: 百済と新羅が使を遣わして調を貢ぎ物を献じた。
sen.e: Kudara and Shiragi sent the envoys to bring cho.
Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes.
sen.cmt: 前の文章と同じにしました。
sen.e: Baekje and Silla sent envoys to bring tributes.

sen.j: 旻法師の死を知り、使を遣わして弔問し、贈り物をした。
sen.e: As he knew Minhoshi's death, he sent the envoy to offer condolences and give presents.
Hearing of Minhoshi's death, he sent an envoy to offer condolences and give presents.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: Hearing of Minhoshi's death, he sent an envoy to offer condolences and give presents.

sen.j: また、法師のために多くの仏像、菩薩像を造らせ、山田寺に安置した。
sen.e: Also, he made them build many Buddha statues and Bosatsu zo (statue of Bosatsu) and they were put in Yamada-dera Temple.
Also, he had many statues of Buddha and Bosatsu made for Minhoshi and had them stored in Yamada-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語に修正しました。
sen.e: Also, he had many statues of Buddha and Bosatsu made for Minhoshi and had them stored in Yamada-dera Temple.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 難破した遣唐使船（高田根麻呂）の生存者5人のうち、筏を作って助けを求めた門部金を褒め、その位を進め禄を授けた。
sen.e: - Among the five who survived in the shipwrecked Kentoshi Ship (TAKADA no Nemaro), he admired MONBU Kin who asked for help by making a raft and raised his rank and gave a stipend to him.
- Among the five who survived the shipwreck of the envoy to Tang (TAKADA no Nemaro), he commended MONBU Kin who built a raft and sought help, raising his rank and offering a stipend.
sen.cmt: 門部金の読み方が不明です。自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Among the five who survived the shipwreck of the envoy to Tang (TAKADA no Nemaro), he commended MONBU Kin who built a raft and sought help, raising his rank and offering a stipend.

tit.cmt: 分かりやすいタイトルにしました。

sen.j: - 皇太子（中大兄）が倭京に遷ることを請うたが、天皇は許さなかった。
sen.e: - Prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) asked for moving to the City in Yamato, but Emperor did not approve it.
- The crown prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) asked him to move to the City in Yamato, but the emperor refused.
sen.cmt: Princeをcrown princeにしました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: - The crown prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) asked him to move to the City in Yamato, but the emperor refused.

sen.j: 皇太子は、皇祖母尊（皇極）と皇后（間人）、皇弟を連れて倭飛鳥河辺行宮に行った。
sen.e: Prince went to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya with his mother (Kogyoku), the Founders of the Imperial Family, Empress (Hashihito) and his younger brother.
The crown prince went to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya with the Founder of the Imperial Family (Empress Kogyoku), the empress (Hashihito) and his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: The crown prince went to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya with the Founder of the Imperial Family (Empress Kogyoku), the empress (Hashihito) and his younger brother.

sen.j: 公卿大夫、百官の人らが皆随って遷った。
sen.e: Kugyo (high court noble), daibu (master) and all the officials followed them and moved there.
Many nobles, masters and officials followed suit.
sen.cmt: 一般的な文章に修正しました。
sen.e: Many nobles, masters and officials followed suit.

sen.j: 天皇は恨んで皇位を去りたいと思い、宮を山碕に造らせ、歌を皇后に送った。
sen.e: Emperor carried a grudge and wished to retire from the throne, made them build a palace in Yamazaki and sent a song to Empress.
Unhappy, the emperor wished to retire from the throne and had a palace built in Yamazaki and sent a song to the empress.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: Unhappy, the emperor wished to retire from the throne and had a palace built in Yamazaki and sent a song to the empress.

sen.j: 白雉5年（654年）
sen.e: Hakuchi 5 (654).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 中臣鎌足に紫冠を授け、封を増した。
sen.e: - He gave murasaki no kouburi to NAKATOMI no Kamatar and raised his stipend.
- He gave murasaki no kouburi (purple cap) to NAKATOMI no Kamatari and raised his stipend.
sen.cmt: 紫冠の説明を追加しました。固有名詞を修正しました。
sen.e: - He gave murasaki no kouburi (purple cap) to NAKATOMI no Kamatari and raised his stipend.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 遣唐使を送った。
sen.e: - He sent Kento-shi.
- He sent an envoy to Tang (China).
sen.cmt: 一般的な文章に修正しました。
sen.e: - He sent an envoy to Tang (China).

sen.j: 押使は高向玄理、大使に河辺麻呂、副使に薬師恵日（5月とも）。
sen.e: The oshi (supreme commander) was TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro, the taishi was KAWABE no maro and the vice commander was Kusushi no Enichi (also in May).
The oshi (supreme commander) was TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro, the commander-in-chief was KAWABE no maro and the vice commander was KUSUSHI no Enichi (as in May).
sen.cmt: Taishiをcommander-in-chiefにしました。氏を大文字にしました。Also in Mayをas in Mayにしました。
sen.e: The oshi (supreme commander) was TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro, the commander-in-chief was KAWABE no maro and the vice commander was KUSUSHI no Enichi (as in May).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 西海使の吉士長丹らが、百済と新羅の送使とともに筑紫に着いた。
sen.e: - KISHI no Nagani of the envoy from Saikai and so on arrived in Tsukushi with the envoys from Kudara and Shiragi.
- KISHI no Nagani and others from the envoy to the western seacoast provinces arrived at Tsukushi with the envoys from Baekje and Silla.
sen.cmt: And othersを追加しました。Saikaiをwestern seacoast provincesにしました。英語版wikipediaと名称を統一しました。
sen.e: - KISHI no Nagani and others from the envoy to the western seacoast provinces arrived at Tsukushi with the envoys from Baekje and Silla.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 天皇の病を聞き、皇太子が、皇祖母尊、皇后、皇弟、公卿らを率いて難波宮に赴いた。
sen.e: - Hearing the Emperor's death, Prince went to Naniwa no Miya, followed by his mother, the Founders of the Imperial Family, Empress, his younger brother, Kugyo and so on.
- Hearing of the Emperor's illness, the crown prince led the Founder of the Imperial Family, the empress, his younger brother and court nobles to Naniwa no Miya Palace.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: - Hearing of the Emperor's illness, the crown prince led the Founder of the Imperial Family, the empress, his younger brother and court nobles to Naniwa no Miya Palace.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 死去。
sen.e: - He passed away.
- He passed away.
- He passed away.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 大坂磯長陵に葬られた。
sen.e: - He was buried in Shinagaryo in Osaka.
- He was buried in Shinagaryo in Osaka.
- He was buried in Shinagaryo in Osaka.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代（27代から37代）
sen.e: Asuka period (from the twenty-seventh to the thirty-seventh).
Asuka Period (27th to 37th emperors)
sen.cmt: 日本語版wikipediaの表記と一致するよう修正しました。
sen.e: Asuka Period (27th to 37th emperors)

sen.j: 陵墓
sen.e: Ryobo (mausoleum).
Ryobo (mausoleum)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Ryobo (mausoleum)

sen.j: 大阪府南河内郡太子町 (大阪府)にある大阪磯長陵（おおさかのしながのみささぎ）とされる。
sen.e: It was considered to be Osaka no Shinaga no Misasagi in aishi-cho, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture (Osaka Prefecture).
Osaka no Shinaga no Misasagi in Taishi Town, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture (Osaka Prefecture) is considered to be his burial place.
sen.cmt: 意味が分かるように順序を変えました。住所を仕様通りにしました。
sen.e: Osaka no Shinaga no Misasagi in Taishi Town, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture (Osaka Prefecture) is considered to be his burial place.
